Income-Driven Repayment plans are designed to make your student loan debt more manageable by reducing your monthly payment amount. If you need to make lower monthly payments or if your outstanding federal student loan debt represents a significant portion of your annual income, one of the following income-driven plans may be right for you:

* As You Earn Repayment Plan (REPAYE)
* Pay As You Earn Repayment Plan (PAYE)
* Income-Based Repayment Plan (IBR)
* Income-Contingent Repayment Plan (ICR)

You can apply for an income-driven repayment plan that limits your payments to a percentage of your income. You can submit an application online or by contacting your loan servicer.

You should complete this if you are not currently on an income-driven plan and want to apply, or if you are currently on an income-driven plan and need to re-certify or make changes to your repayment plan.

You will need to provide verified FSA ID, new applicants will need to provide information about their income and family size, and returning IDR applicants will need to submit annual re-certification of their income and family size.

The entire Income-Driven Repayment process must be completed in a single session, and it may take about 10 minutes to complete.

You will need to provide your FSA ID, personal information, income information, and family size information.
